Package com.stuypulse.stuylib.control

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stuypulse.stuylib.control.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BangBangController, PIDCalculator, PIDController, TBHController
    public abstract class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable
    The controller class is an abstract class that is used to create different controllers. All a class will need to do is implement calculate(double error), and then the user would use the update() functions, which work as a sort of wrapper for the controllers. No matter what controller is used, these functions will always work.

    These functions in the controller are useful for an error based system, and are automatically managed, making implementations of PID easy.

      Creates a basic controller with everything initialized

    • Method Detail

      • setErrorFilter

        public final Controller setErrorFilter​(IFilter filter)
        Lets you specify a filter that will be applied to all measurements that are given to the controller.

        A highly recommended option is the LowPassFilter due to its ability to remove noise, and its ability to not lag behind when there has been a gap in calls. This will slightly degrade the performance of the controller, but it may be necessary sometimes in order to get consistent results.

        This will change the way the controller interacts with the robot and may require more tuning to be done.

        Passing in null will disable the filter.

        Parameters:
        filter - filter to be applied to error measurements
        Returns:
        reference to the controller (so you can chain the commands together)

      • setVelocityFilter

        public final Controller setVelocityFilter​(IFilter filter)
        Lets you specify a filter that will be applied to the velocity measurements.

        This can be used to smooth out the otherwise noisy velocity values.

        This can negatively affect things like the D in PID if set too high and it is recommended that you just filter the error instead.

        Parameters:
        filter - filter to be applied to velocity measurements
        Returns:
        reference to the controller (so you can chain the commands together)

      • setOutputFilter

        public final Controller setOutputFilter​(IFilter filter)
        Lets you specify a filter that will be applied to all of the outputs of the controller.

        If the robot has a tendency to jerk, or motions of the robot are too violent, a filter like the LowPassFilter can reduce jerk while still letting the robot get to max speed. This will slightly degrade the performance of the controller, but it may be necessary sometimes in order to get consistent results.

        This will change the way the controller interacts with the robot and may require more tuning to be done.

        Passing in null will disable the filter.

        Parameters:
        filter - filter to be applied to the outputs of the controller
        Returns:
        reference to the controller (so you can chain the commands together)

      • getRate

        public double getRate()
        Gets the rate of the controller during the last .update() command. This will only return the interval between the last .update() command and the one before it. Thus, the rate may be slightly inconsistent if the update command is not called regularly.

        This function may be overridden if a special controller needs a custom rate.

        Returns:
        the rate of the controller during the last .update() command

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone​(double maxError)
        Get whether or not the Controller has arrived at the target.
        Parameters:
        maxError - the maximum amount of error allowed
        Returns:
        if the controller has arrived at the target

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone​(double maxError,
                      double maxVelocity)
        Get whether or not the Controller has arrived at the target.
        Parameters:
        maxError - the maximum amount of error allowed
        maxVelocity - the maximum amount of change in error over a second allowed
        Returns:
        if the controller has arrived at the target

      • update

        public final double update​(double setpoint,
                           double measurement)
        Update the controller with the measurement that was just made and the set point you would like it to approach

        This function just subtracts the two at this moment.

        Parameters:
        setpoint - desired result
        measurement - measurement of device just made
        Returns:
        controller output

      • update

        public final double update​(double error)
        Update the controller with the error from the destination that you want to reach
        Parameters:
        error - the amount of error from the destination
        Returns:
        controller output
